Episodes.description: First, Homer kills the Grim Reaper and takes his place in Reaper Madness. Then, Professor Frink's father is revived, only to kill people and steal their organs in Frinkenstein. Finally, Bart and Milhouse get a stop watch that can stop time in Stop the World, I Want To Goof Off.
Episodes.title: Treehouse of Horror XIV

Episodes.description: Homer's mother returns to Springfield, and the city pardons her from the charges against her. Mr Burns is furious about this and makes a plan to get Mona Simpson in prison.
Episodes.title: My Mother the Carjacker

Episodes.description: Lisa feuds with Principal Skinner after being elected school president.
Episodes.title: The President Wore Pearls

Episodes.description: Prime minister Tony Blair welcomes the Simpsons to England where they run into author J.K. Rowling and actor Ian McKellen.
Episodes.title: The Regina Monologues

Episodes.description: At the dump Homer is videotaped while being attacked by a bear. The town regards him a coward, so Homer decides to strike back at the bear.
Episodes.title: The Fat and the Furriest

Episodes.description: Krusty decides to do what he never did when he was thirteen years old - have a Bar Mitzvah.
Episodes.title: Today, I Am a Clown

Episodes.description: After spending all his money on an expensive gift for himself, the family thinks Homer should be less of an egoist. Therefore he tries replacing Ned Flanders as the 'good guy' in town.
Episodes.title: Tis the Fifteenth Season

Episodes.description: A concert for babies ends in a riot, so the childless adults of Springfield gather to make the town less child-friendly. Of course Marge is against this proposition, so she forms her own group to prevent a yes on proposition 242.
Episodes.title: Marge vs. Singles, Seniors, Childless Couples and Teens and Gays

Episodes.description: While Lisa and Marge have trouble finding a successor for Snowball II, Homer pretends to be a robot and fights robot races to win Bart's affection.
Episodes.title: I, (Annoyed Grunt)-Bot

Episodes.description: Marge is inspired to write a novel, but the storyline of the book (a fat, mean husband, and a handsome, sweet neighbor) makes Homer jealous.
Episodes.title: Diatribe of a Mad Housewife

Episodes.description: Marge tells Lisa, Bart and Millhouse three history stories because the library doesn't have any.
Episodes.title: Margical History Tour

Episodes.description: Milhouse moves to Capital City, and therefore Lisa and Bart become best friends.
Episodes.title: Milhouse Doesn't Live Here Anymore

Episodes.description: When Maggie is revealed to have an IQ of 167, Lisa is no longer the genius of the family, causing a rivalry between the sisters.
Episodes.title: Smart and Smarter

Episodes.description: Artie Ziff is discovered hiding out in the Simpsons' attic.
Episodes.title: The Ziff Who Came to Dinner

Episodes.description: Marge takes up heavy drinking to spend more time with Homer. Bart and Lisa confront a famous movie director about the drop in quality his films have taken.
Episodes.title: Co-Dependent's Day

Episodes.description: After playing a prank on the whole town, Bart is sentenced to six months of juvenile detention. There he meets Gina, who forces Bart to escape with her.
Episodes.title: The Wandering Juvie

Episodes.description: Mrs. Krabapel falls for Comic Book Guy and they plan a Star Trek like wedding. Principal Skinner plans to prevent it.
Episodes.title: My Big Fat Geek Wedding

Episodes.description: Homer and Marge try to have a vacation without the kids but Bart and Lisa follow them everywhere they go.
Episodes.title: Catch 'Em if You Can

Episodes.description: Homer becomes a costumed vigilante who uses pies for weapons after witnessing Lisa get humiliated at a competition at the state fair.
Episodes.title: Simple Simpson

Episodes.description: Marge and Homer find out that they actually kissed each other at age 10 without knowing they were each other's first kisses, and tell the story about this.
Episodes.title: The Way We Weren't

Episodes.description: An accidental photo showing Bart mooning the American flag makes the Simpsons the most hated family in town.
Episodes.title: Bart-Mangled Banner

Episodes.description: Lisa makes her own newspaper for publishing poems and such, and at the same time Mr Burns decides to buy every media in town to improve his image. In the end Lisa's newspaper is the only media in town not owned by Burns, which inspires the town's inhabitants to create their own newspapers.
Episodes.title: Fraudcast News
